item.title: Bangladesh Prez says interim govt to be formed after dissolving parliament
UN finds possible links of 9 UNRWA staff to October 7 attack on Israel, fires them
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US passes message to Iran not to escalate at 'critical moment' for Middle East
item.description: The U.S. urged other nations to convey to Iran that escalating Middle East tensions isn't in their interest. Secretary of State Antony Blinken emphasized the need for restraint and diplomacy, amid fears of Iranian retaliation against Israel following the assassinations of Hamas and Hezbollah leaders. President Biden and Vice President Harris were briefed on the situation and U.S. response efforts.

item.title: US State Dept urges 'calm and restraint' in Bangladesh, after PM Sheikh Hasina flees
item.description: The United States called for calm after Bangladesh's Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina resigned and fled amid deadly protests. The protests began over job quotas but evolved into a larger movement. The US expressed condolences for those affected and urged for an orderly transition, criticizing Hasina's authoritarian inclinations and the resulting violence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US Supreme Court declines to lift Trumpâ€™s gag order in hush money case
item.description: The Supreme Court rejected Missouri's request to delay Donald Trump's sentencing and lift a gag order before the 2024 election. Trump was found guilty in May of falsifying business records to conceal a payment of $130,000 made to adult film actress Stormy Daniels, in exchange for her silence regarding a sexual encounter she claimed to have had with Trump in the past, prior to the 2016 US election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bangladesh president orders release of jailed ex-PM Khaleda Zia as Sheikh Hasina flees country
item.description: Bangladeshi president Mohammed Shahabuddin ordered the release of former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia, following the military ousting of Sheikh Hasina. This decision, made during a meeting with military and opposition leaders, included freeing all those arrested during recent protests. General Waker announced the formation of an interim government after Hasina fled the country amid violent unrest.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mark Kelly's cryptic tweets leaves netizens confused about Kamala Harris' VP pick
item.description: US Senator Mark Kelly's cryptic social media posts on X, formerly known as Twitter, caused controversy in the Democratic Party. The initial post, suggesting Kelly was no longer considered as Kamala Harris's running mate, was quickly deleted. Kelly later clarified his dedication to serving Arizonans, emphasizing his military and NASA background.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How quota unrest led to Sheikh Hasina's resignation as PM in Bangladesh: A timeline
item.description: Amidst political chaos in Bangladesh, Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina stepped down and fled to Delhi after intense protests led to violence and the breach of her palace. The military took control, promising an interim government. The unrest stemmed from a controversial job quota for descendants of freedom fighters, increasing unemployment, and economic stagnation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bangladesh violence top developments: Deadly clashes claim 300 lives, curfew and internet blackout imposed
item.description: The death toll in Bangladesh's recent clashes has risen to at least 300, with 94 fatalities reported on Sunday. The government imposed a new curfew and internet restrictions to control the protests. Prime Minister Hasina labelled the protesters as "terrorists" and urged the public to act against them. Demonstrators, initially opposing a job quota system, are now demanding Hasina's resignation.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Keir Starmer calls emergency Cobra meeting after violent riots grip UK
item.description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer will hold an emergency Cobra meeting to address the weekend's widespread rioting, where far-right groups targeted asylum seekers and mosques. The PM warned of severe consequences for those involved, emphasising the violent nature of the incidents. The violence included attacks on a hotel housing asylum seekers, police assaults, and mosque vandalism.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Third school hit in four days: Israeli airstrike on Gaza shelter kills 30, injures many
item.description: An Israeli airstrike targeted a Gaza City school serving as a shelter, killing at least 30 people and injuring many others. This incident is the third such attack on schools within four days, primarily affecting women and children. The Israeli military claimed the strike targeted Hamas command centres, while international law experts highlight the responsibility of protecting civilians amid accusations of using human shields.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: â€˜Such a consequential presidentâ€™: Nancy Pelosi says US should add Joe Biden to Mount Rushmore

item.title: 'Don't assume everything is okay': Harry and Meghan on 'protecting' their children
item.description: In a formal interview on CBS News, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle discussed the online threats children face, drawing from their own experiences. They recently launched The Parents Network to support parents dealing with these issues. They emphasised the urgent need for awareness and first responders among parents to prevent tragedies related to social media use and online bullying.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
